The **closing ceremony of the 2018 Winter Olympics** took place at
[Pyeongchang Olympic Stadium](/wiki/Pyeongchang_Olympic_Stadium "Pyeongchang
Olympic Stadium") in [Pyeongchang County](/wiki/Pyeongchang_County
"Pyeongchang County"), [South Korea](/wiki/South_Korea "South Korea"), on 25
February 2018 at 20:00 KST (UTC+9).[1]

##
Ceremony[[edit](/w/index.php?title=2018_Winter_Olympics_closing_ceremony&action=edit&section=1
"Edit section: Ceremony")]

###
Opening[[edit](/w/index.php?title=2018_Winter_Olympics_closing_ceremony&action=edit&section=2
"Edit section: Opening")]

  * South Korean singer [Jang Sa-ik](/wiki/Jang_Sa-ik "Jang Sa-ik") performed [Aegukga](/wiki/Aegukga "Aegukga") with children from [Gangwon Province](/wiki/Gangwon_Province_\(South_Korea\) "Gangwon Province \(South Korea\)").
  * South Korean guitarist Yang Tae-Hwan performed "Winter" of [Vivaldi's Four Seasons](/wiki/Vivaldi%27s_Four_Seasons "Vivaldi's Four Seasons").[2][3]
  * South Korean post-rock band [Jambinai](/wiki/Jambinai "Jambinai") performed "Time of Extinction" including many [geomungo](/wiki/Geomungo "Geomungo") players.[3]

### Parade of
Nations[[edit](/w/index.php?title=2018_Winter_Olympics_closing_ceremony&action=edit&section=3
"Edit section: Parade of Nations")]

Main article: [2018 Winter Olympics closing ceremony flag
bearers](/wiki/2018_Winter_Olympics_closing_ceremony_flag_bearers "2018 Winter
Olympics closing ceremony flag bearers")

The [flag bearers](/wiki/2018_Winter_Olympics_closing_ceremony_flag_bearers
"2018 Winter Olympics closing ceremony flag bearers") of 92 [National Olympic
Committees](/wiki/National_Olympic_Committee "National Olympic Committee")
arrived into the Pyeongchang Olympic Stadium. The flag bearers from each
participating country entered the stadium informally in single file, ordered
by _ganada_ order of the Korean alphabet, and behind them marched all the
athletes, without any distinction or grouping by nationality. Marching
alongside the athletes were [Soohorang](/wiki/Soohorang "Soohorang"), the
Pyeongchang 2018 Olympic mascot, and [Hodori](/wiki/Hodori "Hodori"), mascot
of the [1988 Summer Olympics](/wiki/1988_Summer_Olympics "1988 Summer
Olympics") in Seoul.

### Concert
section[[edit](/w/index.php?title=2018_Winter_Olympics_closing_ceremony&action=edit&section=4
"Edit section: Concert section")]

  * South Korean singer and rapper [CL](/wiki/CL_\(singer\) "CL \(singer\)"), leader of disbanded South Korean girl group [2NE1](/wiki/2NE1 "2NE1") (2009-2016), performed "[The Baddest Female](/wiki/The_Baddest_Female_\(song\) "The Baddest Female \(song\)")" and world hit "[I Am the Best](/wiki/I_Am_the_Best "I Am the Best")".[4]
  * South Korean-Chinese boy group [EXO](/wiki/Exo_\(band\) "Exo \(band\)") performed "[Growl](/wiki/Growl_\(song\) "Growl \(song\)")" and "[Power](/wiki/Power_\(Exo_song\) "Power \(Exo song\)")".[4][5]
  * Dutch DJ [Martin Garrix](/wiki/Martin_Garrix "Martin Garrix") headlined the afterparty segment performing "[Forever](/wiki/Forever_\(Martin_Garrix_and_Matisse_%26_Sadko_song\) "Forever \(Martin Garrix and Matisse & Sadko song\)")", "[Together](/wiki/Together_\(Martin_Garrix_and_Matisse_%26_Sadko_song\) "Together \(Martin Garrix and Matisse & Sadko song\)")", "[Animals](/wiki/Animals_\(Martin_Garrix_song\) "Animals \(Martin Garrix song\)")", "Like I Do", and "[Pizza](/wiki/Pizza_\(song\) "Pizza \(song\)")".[6]

## Handover of the Olympic
flag[[edit](/w/index.php?title=2018_Winter_Olympics_closing_ceremony&action=edit&section=5
"Edit section: Handover of the Olympic flag")]

First, the Greek flag was raised while its anthem played. The Olympic flag was
then lowered and passed, by the mayor of Pyeongchang County, Shim Jae-kook, to
IOC President, [Thomas Bach](/wiki/Thomas_Bach "Thomas Bach"), who then handed
it over to the mayor of Beijing, [Chen Jining](/wiki/Chen_Jining "Chen
Jining"). This was then followed by the raising of the [flag of
China](/wiki/Flag_of_China "Flag of China"), and the playing of its anthem.[1]
The flag will be raised again in [Tokyo](/wiki/Tokyo "Tokyo"),
[Japan](/wiki/Japan "Japan"), for the opening ceremony of the [2020 Summer
Olympics](/wiki/2020_Summer_Olympics "2020 Summer Olympics") on 24 July 2020.

## Beijing 2022
performance[[edit](/w/index.php?title=2018_Winter_Olympics_closing_ceremony&action=edit&section=6
"Edit section: Beijing 2022 performance")]

Beijing, the host city of the [2022 Winter Olympic
Games](/wiki/2022_Winter_Olympics "2022 Winter Olympics"), presented a special
performance _See you in Beijing in 2022_ directed by Chinese film director
[Zhang Yimou](/wiki/Zhang_Yimou "Zhang Yimou"), who also presented the [2008
Summer Olympics opening](/wiki/2008_Summer_Olympics_opening_ceremony "2008
Summer Olympics opening ceremony") and
[closing](/wiki/2008_Summer_Olympics_closing_ceremony "2008 Summer Olympics
closing ceremony") ceremonies. The presentation featured two
[pandas](/wiki/Giant_panda "Giant panda") skating and people forming red lines
that became a [dragon](/wiki/Chinese_dragon "Chinese dragon"), as pandas and
dragons are national icons for China. The skaters also trail lines to form the
emblem of the games. [China](/wiki/China "China")'s [Paramount
leader](/wiki/Paramount_leader "Paramount leader") [Xi
Jinping](/wiki/Xi_Jinping "Xi Jinping") made a cameo appearance by video
expressing the welcome message on behalf of the [Chinese
people](/wiki/Chinese_people "Chinese people").

## Games declared
closed[[edit](/w/index.php?title=2018_Winter_Olympics_closing_ceremony&action=edit&section=7
"Edit section: Games declared closed")]

IOC President Thomas Bach formally closed the games, calling them 'The Games
of New Horizons.' Soon after, the cauldron was extinguished.
